executive_summary: The Fire Extinguisher Manufacturing industry manufactures fixed fire-suppression systems and hand-portable fire extinguishers used to control small fires, typically in emergency situations. Additionally, this industry manufacturers replacement parts and equipment associated with fire-suppression systems and extinguishers. Regulations mandating installation of fixed suppression systems, as well as the placement of portable fire extinguishers in workplaces, factories and other establishments, provide a baseline of demand for industry products.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry manufactures fire suppression systems and extinguishers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Fire Extinguisher Manufacturing industry manufactures fixed fire-suppression systems and portable fire extinguishers used to control small fires, typically in emergency situations. Additionally, this industry manufacturers replacement parts and equipment associated with fire-suppression systems and extinguishers.

Regulations that mandate the installation of fire-suppression systems in hazardous areas, as well as the placement and accessibility of fire extinguishers in public and residential buildings, provide a stable basis of support for industry demand.
Rising residential construction and industrial activity over the past five years has boosted demand for fixed fire-suppression systems or extinguishers designed for factories and homes.
The boost in demand has enabled profit to expand to 7.4% during the current period.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Exports collapsed but domestic demand strong
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: While domestic demand during the current period has been strong, the industry's exports have collapsed, declining at an annualized 10.5% over the five years to 2021.
The strong growth in residential construction, further boosted by the COVID-19 pandemic, have caused revenue for the industry to rise at an estimated annualized rate of 4.4% to $1.5 billion in 2021.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Industry revenue growth is expected to reverse over the five years to 2026, declining at an annualized rate of 0.3% to $1.5 billion.
An anticipated slowdown in the construction sector, particularly in private residential construction, will help push industry demand downward.
A decreasing trade-weighted index should prevent substantial declines in industry revenue as exports are forecast to return to stable growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Profit margin to remain stable at 7.3%
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The average industry profit margin is expected to be 7.3% of revenue in 2026, slightly down from 7.4% in 2021.
Sustained gains in profit is expected to attract new industry operators, but at a slower rate. Establishments are expected to increase at an annualized 1.8% to 36 companies in 2026.
On the other hand, industry employment is expected to stagnate at 2,881 individuals.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures fixed fire-suppression systems and hand-portable fire extinguishers used to control small fires, often in emergency situations. Additionally, this industry manufacturers replacement parts and equipment associated with fire-suppression systems and extinguishers. The industry excludes other professional fire equipment used by firefighters.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Wholesalers that resell industry products are the Fire Extinguisher Manufacturing industry's largest market, accounting for an estimated 64.8% of revenue. Hand-portable fire extinguishers, as well as parts and components for fixed fire-suppression systems, are commonly sold to wholesalers of all specialties, including machinery, hardware, plumbing and heating equipment wholesalers.

Construction companies purchase a variety of fire-extinguishing equipment when building or renovating structures. Industrial facilities, meanwhile, are often at increased risk of fire and require significant spending on precautions as a result. Combined, this market accounts for an estimated 15.3% of industry revenue.

Exports account for an estimated 8.7% of industry revenue this year. Overseas markets are primarily driven by commercial and residential construction. Due to geographic proximity and favorable trade relationships, the Fire Extinguisher Manufacturing industry exports its products to countries like Canada and Mexico, as well as the EU.

Federal, state and municipal governments are another vital market for the Fire Extinguisher Manufacturing industry. Combined with retailers, they represent the remaining 5.7% of revenue-generating customers for manufacturers.

Business users purchase fire-suppression systems, portable fire extinguishers and related equipment are another major market for this industry and comprise an estimated 5.5% of industry revenue in 2021. These diversified markets include hotels and rental spaces, as well as restaurants and other food service establishments, which demand fixed system wet and dry fire-suppression systems.

products_and_services.product_description: The largest segment is Stored Pressure Fire Extinguishers at 78.7%, followed by Carbon Dioxide Fire Extinguishers at 11.6%, Clean Agent Fire Extinguishers at 4.1%, and Other Extinguishers and Parts at 5.6%.
The most common type of fire extinguisher are multipurpose dry chemical portable extinguishers, also known as stored pressure extinguishers.
Another popular agent used in portable fire extinguishers is carbon dioxide. These clean agent fire extinguishers are used for Class B and C fires and more common in industrial settings.

Clean agent extinguishers use halon alternatives that inhibit the chemical reaction of a fire. Over the past five years and the past decade, this product segment's share of industry revenue has declined, as Halotron units have been replaced by more environmentally friendly alternatives.

Replacement parts and equipment for fixed fire-suppression systems, such as storage containers, recharges of extinguishing agents, control panel components, piping and discharge nozzles are also included in the other minor industry products. This segment also includes parts for portable fire extinguishers.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Commercial construction demand includes spending on office buildings, hospitals, factories, power plants, mining shafts, communication lines, farms, railroads and schools. Most of these locations are required to keep fire extinguishers on premises. As a result, spending on new or renovated commercial structures generally increases demand for industry products. Likewise, residential demand for fire extinguishers is strongly tied with the construction of new single-family homes and apartment buildings.

Activity in the mining, manufacturing, electric, gas and transport industries also affects demand. Industrial facilities represent elevated risks for liquid, electrical and combustible metals fires, so these locations often keep ample fire-fighting equipment on hand. For example, fixed dry chemical systems are commonly installed in industrial settings to protect against ordinary combustible (Class A), flammable liquid (Class B) and electrical equipment (Class C) fires.

The trade-weighted index (TWI) reflects the relative value of the US dollar against the currencies of its trading partners. A strengthening of the US dollar could potentially encourage industry imports as portable fire extinguishers produced overseas become relatively cheaper for US buyers. Simultaneously, exports from US manufacturers would likely decrease, harming industry revenue as a result.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Over the five years to 2021, industry imports have increased dramatically at an annualized rate of 9.1% to $189.4 million. The top import sources include Mexico, China, Canada and the United Kingdom.
Over the five years to 2021, exports are expected to decline an annualized 10.5% to $133.4 million in 2021. The top export destinations include Canada, Saudi Arabia, the United Kingdom and Germany.

The Underwriters Laboratories (UL) sets manufacturing guidelines and rates PFEs.

FAQs.question: How is your company being impacted by current import and export activity?
FAQs.answer: Exports have been declining since 2015, while imports, in particular from Mexico, have been increasing.

FAQs.question: Have input and commodity prices affected your overhead in recent years?
FAQs.answer: Steel and other key commodity prices have fluctuated a lot recently, and tariffs threaten broad price increases.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition possibilities within well-established infrastructure or manufacturing networks?
FAQs.answer: A number of larger manufacturers are owned by manufacturing giants with access to cheaper bulk-buying opportunities.

FAQs.question: Have you been leveraging any new technologies to lower wage costs or other expenses?
FAQs.answer: Wages for a number of larger companies in the industry have been declining as they're able to increase automation and improve their efficiency in the manufacturing process.

FAQs.question: Are you exploring any new opportunities to enhance your product technology levels?
FAQs.answer: The main technological advances in the industry include variations of chemical preparations suited for fighting certain kinds of fires.

FAQs.question: Have you benefited from any new regulations or policies?
FAQs.answer: The NFPA develops more than 300 codes and standards to promote fire safety and minimize fire-related risks.

FAQs.question: Have you had any difficulty recently with compliance issues or changing regulations in the US manufacturing industry?
FAQs.answer: Compliance with federal, state and local environmental legislation regarding the disposal of hazardous waste created during the production process constitutes some of the main regulatory pressures.

FAQs.question: How do your profit margins compare with competitors?
FAQs.answer: Profit margins are often thin for industry operators, but access to a wide wholesale network and cheaper labor from overseas factories are often key to beating the industry average.

FAQs.question: How frequently do you purchase new equipment and technologies?
FAQs.answer: Though technological expansion is gradual, expansion often requires expensive new factory inputs.

FAQs.question: How have you updated your practices to comply with new environmental regulation?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturers experience a range of regulations regarding the generation and disposal of hazardous wastes.

FAQs.question: What issues does your organization support and promote?
FAQs.answer: Raising public awareness about the dangers of residential fires and laws that require fire extinguishers to be kept on premises can help the industry increase market penetration.

FAQs.question: What affect does automation have on your profit margins?
FAQs.answer: The ability to automate processes reduces wages costs and increases efficiencies.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the trade-weighted index?
FAQs.answer: As the TWI strengthens, exports of portable fire extinguishers become relatively more expensive and less attractive to customers overseas.

FAQs.question: In which industries do your clients primarily operate?
FAQs.answer: Because most nonresidential buildings require the placement of fire extinguishers, new structures or spending on commercial structures generally increases demand for industry products.

FAQs.question: What portion of your work is in the residential construction market?
FAQs.answer: Regulations requiring the placement of fire equipment in multifamily establishments and general population safety concerns bolster demand for fire extinguishers when new residential homes and buildings are constructed.
